player: Thabo Sefolosha (groin) will be a game-time decision for Wednesday's matchup with Miami.
Tiago Splitter (calf) will not play on Monday vs. the Clippers.
Joe Harris (left ankle) is being listed as probable for Wednesday's game against the Knicks.
Jeremy Lin stated on Tuesday that he hopes to return to the team within 2-3 weeks.
Demetrius Jackson (illness) will not play on Tuesday vs. the Wizards.
Avery Bradley (Achilles) has been ruled out for Wednesday's game against the Raptors.
Cody Zeller (right quad) is questionable to play Wednesday vs. the Warriors.
Taj Gibson (ankle) will return to the starting lineup on Wednesday vs. the Thunder, sending Bobby Portis back to the bench.
An MRI taken on Kevin Love's back came back clean.
J.R. Smith hasn't done any cardio exercises since fracturing his thumb on Dec. 20, but hopes to receive clearance to begin working out at his doctor's appointment on Friday.
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Andrew Bogut (right hamstring) has been ruled out for Wednesday's game against the 76ers.
Updating a previous report, Deron Williams (toe) has been ruled out for Wednesday's game against the 76ers.
J.J. Barea (left calf strain) is not close to practicing and head coach Rick Carlisle expects him to remain on the sidelines even after the All-Star break.
Wilson Chandler (neck) is probable for Wednesday against the Grizzlies.
Will Barton (ankle) is doubtful to play against the Grizzlies on Wednesday.
Nikola Jokic (hip) has been ruled out for Wednesday's game against the Grizzlies.
Emmanuel Mudiay (back), Nikola Jokic (hip) and Will Barton (ankle) will likely be game-time decisions for Wednesday's game against the Grizzlies.
Jon Leuer hit just 1-of-5 shots for six points, six rebounds and two blocks in 26 minutes Monday before leaving the game with a bloody forehead, courtesy of a Jonas Jerebko elbow.
Zaza Pachulia (right rotator cuff strain) will miss at least the next week of action.
Stephen Curry (illness) will play against the Hornets on Wednesday night.
David West (thumb) is ramping up his activity and will be reevaluated early next week.
Kevin Seraphin (knee) is listed as questionable for Wednesday's game vs. the Magic.
Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) is hopeful that he can get back on the court for Wednesday's game against the Magic.
Chris Paul (left thumb) was spotted doing some light shooting and dribbling following Tuesday's practice.
Brice Johnson (back) is nearing a return according to coach Doc Rivers.
Julius Randle (pneumonia) will not play on Tuesday vs. the Nuggets.
Deyonta Davis (foot) will not play on Saturday vs. the Jazz.
Luke Babbitt (ankle) went through shootaround, but he'll be a game-time call for Wednesday's matchup with the Hawks.
James Johnson (shoulder) practiced on Tuesday and appears to be on track to play Wednesday night vs. Atlanta.
Josh Richardson (foot) has "been able to do more" recently according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) went through a full contact on Wednesday and is getting closer to return.
Dante Cunningham (right wrist sprain) is questionable to play Wednesday vs. the Pistons.
Tyreke Evans (ankle, rest) will not play Tuesday vs. Toronto or Wednesday vs. Detroit.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Kristaps Porzingis (illness) will not suit up for Tuesday's game against the Wizards and Willy Hernangomez will draw the start in his place.
Derrick Rose (ankle) has shed his walking boot, although he remains doubtful to play Wednesday vs. the Nets.
Lance Thomas (face) is still a week away from returning.
Enes Kanter (fractured right arm) had surgery on Friday and will be re-evaulated in about four weeks.
C.J. Wilcox (knee tendinitis) will be in a walking boot for the next 3-4 weeks.
Jodie Meeks underwent surgery to correct his dislocated right thumb on Tuesday, and he will be out indefinitely.
Robert Covington (right hand contusion) and Joel Embiid (knee) will not play Wednesday vs. the Mavericks.
Joel Embiid (knee) will not play Wednesday vs. the Mavericks.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
76ers' head coach Brett Brown said that Ben Simmons (foot) is still "a ways away" from being cleared for 5-on-5 work.
Updating a previous report, Dragan Bender (ankle) is out on Monday vs. the Grizzlies.
Ed Davis (wrist) said he's planning on returning to the court for Friday's game against the Mavericks.
Festus Ezeli (knee) will not be with the Blazers on their four-game trip, but his agent says it is
because of an impending knee surgery.
Pau Gasol (left hand) is undergoing surgery to repair the fracture of his fourth metacarpal.
Garrett Temple will get an MRI on his injured left hamstring on Wednesday morning.
Rudy Gay (Achilles) expects to be ready for training camp prior to the start of the 2017-18 season after undergoing successful surgery on his ruptured left Achilles’ tendon.
Omri Casspi (right calf) will miss at least one more week of action.
DeMar DeRozan (sore right ankle) will not play Tuesday vs. the Pelicans or Wednesday vs. the Celtics.
The Raptors have recalled Delon Wright and Bruno Caboclo from the D-League.
Derrick Favors (rest) has been ruled out for Wednesday's game against the Bucks.
According to published reports, the Wizards believe that Ian Mahinmi (knees) has a chance to play before the All-Star break.
Danuel House (fractured right wrist) will be re-evaluated later this week to determine if he will be cleared for contact.
